org.opentosca.toscana.core.parse.converter

Class KeyReflector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentosca.toscana.core.parse.converter.KeyReflector

  • public class KeyReflector
extends java.lang.Object
    Util class for detecting real subtypes for wrapping entities. Initially developed because of RootNode.getCapabilities() - the corresponding ToscaKey RootNode.CAPABILITIES does only contain the type information 'Capability' (which is abstract), and not actual subtypes of the members in the collection. In order to detect the real type, reflection had to be used.

    The code is quite abstract and hard to read, so here is a brief summary of the applied algorithm:
    1. Detects the class type of the enclosing node of given entity.
    2. Find all declared ToscaKeys of this class type (using reflection), including inherited ToscaKeys.
    3. Remove all ToscaKeys from list whose type is not a subtype of given base type.
    4. Remove all ToscaKeys from list whose name does not match the name of given entity.
    5. Remove 'shadowed' ToscaKeys from found keys. A ToscaKey is shadowed in case a key with the same name is declared lower in the inheritance hierarchy.
